info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 02 at 6:45PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN REEVES... NORTHWESTERN WARD AND SOUTHERN LOVING COUNTIES THROUGH 715 PM CDT... At 644 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles northwest of Toyah, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Reeves, northwestern Ward and southern Loving Counties. This includes Interstate 20 near mile marker 25. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for western and southwestern Texas.
